title: Unknown lifetime mentioned in error

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur. 
-->

Given the [following code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=53bae021d140c16499039d5c560c77c8): <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
fn main() {
    let map = |map| {
        bar(map)
    };
    foo(map);
}

fn foo<Access>(mut map: Access)
where
    Access: FnMut(&dyn Fn(i32) -> i32)
{
    map(&|_|0)
}

fn bar<F: FnOnce(i32) -> i32>(_: F) {}
```

The current output is:

```
error: implementation of `FnOnce` is not general enough
 --> src/main.rs:5:5
  |
5 |     foo(map);
  |     ^^^ implementation of `FnOnce` is not general enough
  |
  = note: closure with signature `fn(&'3 dyn Fn(i32) -> i32)` must implement `FnOnce<(&'1 (dyn Fn(i32) -> i32 + '1),)>`, for any two lifetimes `'1` and `'2`...
  = note: ...but it actually implements `FnOnce<(&'3 dyn Fn(i32) -> i32,)>`, for some specific lifetime `'3`
```

The error message mentions lifetimes '1 and '2, but only annotates '1.

I am unsure if this is just a bad error message, or whether the program should actually compile like it does when removing the `map` intermediate variable: [link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=4b0c4d5e7fe45ce1de815da90fe4c790)
